intro: Oxytropis arctobia var. hyperarctica, commonly known as Arctic locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. This species is adapted to cold climates and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats.
